In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the solution in Julia using DataFrames package:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> year(x)*100 + month(x), df.dt)
end
```
This function takes a DataFrame as input and adds a new column `ym` to it. The `map` function applies the anonymous function `(x -> year(x)*100 + month(x))` to each element in the `dt` column, which extracts the year and month from the DateTime object `x`, multiplies the year by 100 and adds the month, then assigns this value to the new column `ym`.

Here is an example of how you can use it:

```julia
df = DataFrame(dt=DateTime[now()+Month(i) for i in 1:3], x=[1,2,3])
add_yearmonth(df)
display(df)
```
This will create a new column `ym` with values like "202204" (assuming the current year is 2022 and we're in April).
